TopicTitle: What Are Things You've Heard That Made You Facepalm?

Articles.Content:
RULES:

\*NEVER make fun of anyone specifically. Just mention the thing they said.

\***STAY ON TOPIC**

\*Do NOT refer to other's posts on this forum. That hasn't ended well in the past.

So what are some things you've heard from some people or things that made you facepalm? It can be related to anything, space, reading, history, etc.

Mine, well, Michael Bay's impression of stopping an asteroid with a Shuttle. GG Bay GG. Armageddon.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-22T12:09:55Z" title="04/22/2015 12:09  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 22, 2015</time> by michaelsteele3**

"I'm alot older than 16, if you take timezone into account"

.......^intentionally mispelled for emphasis of stupid
Why don't we make it a rule that posts here cannot refer to things other forum members have said? Because in the past, threads like this have tended to turn nasty over that sort of thing.

Reusability lowers rocket costs. (And this is typically asserted as universal. Despite the caveats of things like STS, Buran, Pegasus, X-33, X-34, DC-X, that the Falcons have \*not\* demonstrated it yet...)

"When two objects have the same inertia (speed), they orbit EACH OTHER"

-One of my classmates who wrote it down for a school assignment
My friend was very nervous during a geography oral exam, and he blurted out that "one Earth day has 29 hours".
"for some reason, when I eat this food I get less hungry" followed by a few seconds of silence and then hysterical laughter
I just finished playing "The Evil Within". That whole game makes me facepalm.

"What has space done for us?"

That's a pretty general one. But the answer is "more than you ever did," in most cases.

EDIT: keep religion out of this please. Many enjoy this thread, and it is under threat of locking.
